content: A debate exists regarding whether application-layer startups or foundation model providers will capture the majority of AI's value.
Cursor's $2.3 billion funding round and its Composer model are considered a test case in the debate over value capture in the AI ecosystem.
The rapid evolution of foundational models poses a threat to application-layer startups, potentially rendering their apps obsolete before they achieve significant scale.

Counterarguments suggest that vertical workflows, embedded enterprise integrations, proprietary usage exhaust, and feedback loops could serve as durable competitive advantages (moats) for application-layer AI companies.
